intro: Lunathyrium pycnosorum f. glabrum, commonly known as the smooth-leaved mooncup, is a rare and delicate plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, white, cup-shaped flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant has smooth, glabrous leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodland areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a threatened species in its native range.
